DA87A5CF4A5F4876BCDA4BCB02505012.description: Identify and explain language contact phenomena that give rise to Anglicisms and to code-switching.

89C91D24A5A84F0A827485809F8DC43C.description: Identify and give examples of different Spanish language dialects based on geographic origin.

3BA3975AD5744455AD01C605E3E7CC25.description: Identify and analyze appropriate etiquette common to Hispanic cultures.

413801218C974467BE8560F8C0424335.description: Evaluate the choice of words, expressions, and style considering the purpose and context of a communication.

627176ADACB74180A8384D0130096500.description: Identify the form and function of words, phrases, and clauses, including interrelated clauses in complex sentences and use them effectively

1D6BC7F60AE546B782E5338E11A7F645.description: Analyze and explain how immediate context and broader social, cultural, regional, and professional variables influence the use of language, citing characteristics such as level of formality, slang, jargon, and emotional impact.

BF7BFF5D949F495F90D78C18C2A3C942.description:
Recognize and use appropriate language form and style to communicate with different audiences, for different purposes, 
    and in different settings

BED8957C9EF44142A9D8CA385356D238.description: Examine the origin, history, denotation, connotation, and usage of Spanish words and phrases by consulting dictionaries, thesauruses, handbooks, electronic media, and other sources of information about language.

47A10CAFCB984185AA8FDAE145BCB381.description: Identify use of different forms of tu an Ud. (such as vosotros) in Spanish speaking countries.

B67B7F8B7C304D1EA6B2EF66CEDA9811.description: At a grade-appropriate level, recognize common errors, made by native speakers, in the use of the Spanish language and know how and when to correct them.

E67A7B30FFF44B92ADAAF89130091084.description: Employ principles of agreement related to number, gender, and case.

D84ED413280D4D9A9A28215629756FE2.description: Punctuate complex sentences correctly, including appropriate use of dialogue, citations, colons, hyphens, dashes, ellipses, and italics.

C5B6A686F71240749CB34E0362F71695.description: Use correct tenses to indicate the relative order of events.

CEB65CB4DEF148D187CF1C5090C3B3BB.description: Use correct grammar, spelling, punctuation, and capitalization

18A0AB4D8B894E9E9D40B0842E2B9ADF.description: Prepare for and participate in formal debates by summarizing then refuting opposing positions and citing persuasive evidence.

D2C3870A9BCA495F9ABCD3414B7E8E3E.description: Speak fluently with varied inflection and effective eye contact, enunciating and pronouncing clearly at an appropriate rate and volume, using the appropriate style of speaking Spanish according to audience and purpose.

C3DE3D3583A641268F61958BF0BCDBEC.description: Support and defend a thesis statement using various references including media and electronic resources.

C0973822C52845518F3D5AC987D2C998.description: Use speaking skills to participate in and lead group discussions; analyze the effectiveness of the spoken interactions based upon the ability of the group to achieve its goals.

1C1794D7C8D44F5D99BD724F583B35EB.description: Describe and provide examples of dialectical differences as contributors to enriching Spanish cultures and societies.

0B0684B3E52C447A87DE3011E52E78B1.description: Use verbal and nonverbal strategies to maintain communication and to resolve conflict (e.g., mediation skills, formal and informal bargaining skills).

DE930F2D13084B348817B23279D22012.description: Deliver planned and impromptu oral presentations, as individuals and members of a group, conveying results of research, projects or literature studies to a variety of audiences using appropriate visual aids and available technology.

6C37EB16538A45C4A5E30F1B61B4EC09.description: Orally communicate information, opinions, and ideas using language appropriate to the situation, purpose, and audience

F54CDC11388E4A7C84E08B5638CD4CA1.description: Demonstrate understanding of the relationship of verbal and nonverbal messages within a context (e.g., contradictory, supportive, repetitive, substitutive).

ADABFE2E87874154AB744390BEB3B454.description: Apply listening skills as individuals and members of a group in a variety of settings (e.g., lectures, discussions, conversations, team projects, presentations, interviews).

8E4A4424B3404AC998A3A0C6B0103BAA.description: Listen effectively in formal and informal situations

37AF32AB533F4FF89DD57EC227E822E5.description: Credit primary and secondary sources in a form appropriate for presentation or publication for a particular audience.

43952B977A1E4872B3D917C857B1BC6D.description: Evaluate written work for its effectiveness and make recommendations for its improvement, based on self-assessment and reflection.

64AE47B49C5D413CAA3DE0BF7DD577D9.description: At grade-appropriate level, write to reflect customs and culture of Spanish-speaking countries and communities, including personal experiences and references.

8E9901D5431049C681D9DF631DDF504F.description: Produce, edit, revise and format work for submission and/or publication (e.g., manuscript form, appropriate citation of sources) using contemporary technology.

2FA5F7F74AEB48ADBE1EBD8401C234A3.description: Expand ideas by using modifiers and subordination.

C2E3652463054C1CBE71C177CFF94FC6.description: Establish central idea, organization, elaboration and unity in relation to purpose and audience.

2C74510F5C8D44D7B8EE4CF4EB82714A.description: Using contemporary technology, produce documents of publication quality for specific purposes and audiences; exhibit a variety of writing techniques including clarity of focus, logic of organization, appropriate elaboration and support and overall coherence.

19454579637242E1B6D70663F1335BE0.description: Produce grammatically correct documents using standard manuscript specifications for a variety of purposes and audiences.

59596E433B07415DB731B6D24E4F2D32.description: Plan, compose, edit, and present clear and effective writing in Spanish

A4E76628E23A466C9946BF6DA2ED712D.description: Compose and publish analytic and reflective writing that conveys knowledge, experience, insights, and opinions to an intended audience.

931A8CDC7E704520AB736375695FAFBF.description: Write expository paragraphs that reflect the logic and rhetoric of the Spanish language.

F663D2AB2E6A43B19E0467CF9AC747E2.description: Using contemporary technology, create a research presentation or prepare a documentary related to academic, technical or occupational topics and present the findings in oral or multimedia formats.

15EC3A9BC9554FAA895F0A7D8C217D7B.description: Communicate information and ideas in narrative, informative and persuasive writing with clarity and effectiveness in a variety of written forms using appropriate traditional and/or electronic formats; adapt content, vocabulary, voice and tone to the audience, purpose and situation.

2DDDA1CF950540889977BD8F86D10A36.description: Write for real or potentially real situations in academic, professional and civic contexts (e.g., college applications, job applications, business letters, petitions).

88B2A20BC4384635BAD4335E6E4B3D6A.description: Write a coherent argument that takes a position, accurately summarizes an opposing position, refutes that position, and cites persuasive evidence.

2B6FCFA4E059452CAF34EDB9D8177556.description: Write autobiographical and biographical narratives in a mature style characterized by suitable vocabulary, descriptive detail, effective syntax, an appropriate voice, a variety of sentence structures, clear coordination and subordination of ideas, and rhetorical devices that help establish tone and reinforce meaning.

B4A49F3006E14C598B83AA09C4D56325.description: Write creative fiction that includes an authentic setting, discernible tone, coherent plot, distinct characters, effective detail, believable dialogue, and reasonable resolution of conflict.

4B7C7AC1949C4E65948BDB723DB1DAAE.description: Produce written text in Spanish to communicate with different audiences for a variety of purposes

F79B5F01E4C84CCD8B9D7351260CA90F.description: Read grade-appropriate material with fluency, accuracy and understanding.

ABA2520BBE9A4DFCBCBB729FC6C83BC8.description: Use tables, graphs and maps to challenge arguments, defend conclusions, and persuade others.

329040C7AB084AC2A14E9058B2056387.description: Evaluate the usefulness of information, synthesize information to support a thesis, and present information in a logical manner in oral and written forms.

770BA4E0A151418EBF9395B5C571D812.description: Select a variety of materials in Spanish to read for discovery, appreciation, and enjoyment, summarize the readings, and connect them to prior knowledge and experience.

B163F672C6DE48068114FA55081F91EF.description: Read in Spanish for a variety of purposes

D7FB7357BC4E4C7C859AC928353E5BA1.description: Identify philosophical assumptions and basic beliefs underlying selected Spanish text.

A8DD6AC0CB4444E2B1CB09329EFAF5D2.description: Evaluate the reliability and authenticity of information conveyed in a text to determine bias, using criteria based on knowledge of the author, topic, and context and analysis of logic, evidence, propaganda, and language.

05B32C15B75048F89AFD1E1E05E8591D.description: Apply tests of logic and reasoning to informational and persuasive texts

82D602E543334EAD96271C1D304F3202.description: Investigate and report on ways in which a writer has influenced or been influenced by historical, social, and cultural issues or events.

375F367C53774C8FA8304B5F17C49E0E.description: Compare texts that reflect customs, traditions, regions, and cultures.

69840834EF574033AE6B05007304A68A.description: Draw on a broad base of knowledge about the universal themes of literature in Spanish such as initiation, love and duty, heroism, illusion and reality, salvation, death and rebirth, and explain how these themes are developed in a particular work of literature.

C0AC457C8CC14CB88034E6E15C51342E.description: Apply knowledge gained from literature as a means of understanding contemporary and historical economic, social and political issues and perspectives.

A2150A0930864181926FE00D89705403.description: Develop, explain, and defend interpretations of complex literary works in Spanish.

5D7A492678A0497C972AE19ECF3B9154.description: Analyze how authors and illustrators use text and art to express and emphasize their ideas (e.g., imagery, multiple points of view).

3EE6D18ECE724A0685E482047255D257.description: Describe the influence of the author’s language structure and word choice to convey the author’s viewpoint.

E69B8E4E8A2348B3A1953E9AE7E27611.description: Summarize and make generalizations from content and relate them to the purpose of the material.

43C62BCECD9049AFA85318F36FCE2B09.description: Critically evaluate information  and perspectives from multiple sources.

2DA88B64BE264CA5A861E169C363FA8B.description: Develop and articulate defensible points of view on individual, community, national, and world issues reflected in literary and nonliterary texts.

D63546890C4548599885C915DA8890C7.description: Read, interpret, and critically analyze literary and non-literary materials from Spanish-speaking countries and communities

98D34A85A0AA4DA7BD1E572BEA00483D.description: Analyze how information is presented as fact, fiction, or a combination of fact and fiction to influence the reader.

4122DA12F06A40F09009509C9EDD5D97.description: Analyze the development of form (e.g., short stories, essays, speeches, poetry, plays, novels) and purpose in literature from Spanish-speaking countries and communities.

2AB1F5E28861463A885FA091D6D49B46.description: Evaluate relationships between and among character, plot, setting, theme, conflict and resolution and their influence on the effectiveness of a literary piece.

91759B83568449899FFC5165A507C09E.description: Analyze and evaluate the effective use of literary techniques (e.g., figurative language, allusion, dialogue, description, symbolism, word choice, dialect) in classic and contemporary works of literature in Spanish representing a variety of forms and media.

004157F737DA43D4AA3915445F2A0FE2.description: Recognize, analyze, and evaluate literary elements and techniques used to convey meaning

7E8957A5CC8C4A32B07E691685B09DD0.description: Use a variety of strategies, including questions and predictions, to guide reading of complex materials.

3BCDB1B53E8C4A1BAB156E05469A0413.description: Read grade-appropriate material with fluency and understanding.

3E0B3A342C9C45269C1734C66ABB822E.description: Check for understanding and clarity by evaluating a variety of texts, in and out of school, for purpose, structure, content and details.

5691119CFDF94CB8A553A496DE7D91F5.description: Analyze the defining characteristics and structures of a variety of complex literary genres and describe how genre affects the meaning and function of the texts.

69EDCB162820476C84BBA9C0CF11755B.description: Relate reading to prior knowledge and experience and make connections with other texts.

D8F1533D980F4D2BB2A4A81505760799.description: Evaluate the choice of words, expressions, and style considering the purpose and context of a communication.

4ED49D2C81804736BBC71D0FD97DBEF1.description: Identify and analyze Spanish word origins and derivations and use idioms, analogies, metaphors and similes to extend vocabulary development.

3E930E35B2144265A744D05BCC54C6A6.description: Apply reading strategies to improve understanding of Spanish printed text
